unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Momentum Across India**
normalised: Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Momentum Across India

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26, 2023 – The nationwide deployment of smart meters under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS) is gaining traction, with significant progress reported across several states. Tata Power Delhi Distribution Limited (TPDDL) has announced the successful installation of over 200,000 smart meters in North Delhi, reducing aggregate technical and commercial (AT&C) losses.
normalised: New Delhi, october twenty sixth, two thousand and twenty three – The nationwide deployment of smart meters under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S) is gaining traction, with significant progress reported across several states. Tata Power Delhi Distribution Limited (T P D D L) has announced the successful installation of over two hundred thousand smart meters in North Delhi, reducing aggregate technical and commercial (A T and C) losses.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, in Maharashtra, Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd (MSEDCL) is piloting advanced metering infrastructure (AMI) in Nagpur, aiming for complete smart meter coverage by December 31, 2024. The project aims to enhance billing accuracy and reduce power theft, estimated to cost the state exchequer Rs. 25,000 crore annually. Consumers will also benefit from Time-of-Day (ToD) tariffs, potentially lowering electricity bills during off-peak hours.

unnormalised: Power Minister R.K. Singh reiterated the government's commitment to achieving universal smart metering by 2025, emphasizing the critical role of smart meters in modernizing the Indian power grid. A national conference is scheduled for 10:00 hrs on November 15, 2023, in Chennai to discuss challenges and opportunities in smart meter deployment. Initial reports indicate increased efficiency by as much as 15% in areas covered by the scheme.
